alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau; Eastern Clay; Inland Nassau; South Central Duval; Trout River; Union; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nassau, northern Bradford, southeastern Baker, Union, northwestern Clay, Duval, southeastern Camden and south central Charlton Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near St. Marys to near Jacksonville to New River. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, St. Marys, Kingsland, Fernandina Beach, Starke, Lake Butler, Callahan, Raiford, Jacksonville International Arpt and Kings Bay Base. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
